explanations.machine learning: The paper applies four different learners (Naive Bayes, k-Nearest Neighbour, Neural Network, and Support Vector Machine) to detect patterns in textual data, which is a clear application of machine learning techniques.
explanations.supervised learning: The learners used (Naive Bayes, k-Nearest Neighbour, Neural Network, and Support Vector Machine) are all supervised learning methods, as they are trained to classify textual data based on labeled examples.
explanations.classification: The paper aims to identify disclosures that result in abnormal risk exposures, which involves classifying textual data into relevant categories.
explanations.support vector machine: The paper explicitly mentions the use of Support Vector Machine (SVM) as one of the learners applied to the textual data.
explanations.SVM: SVM is an abbreviation for Support Vector Machine, which is one of the methods used in the paper.
explanations.neural network: The paper mentions the use of Neural Network as one of the learners applied to detect patterns in the textual data.
